subject: Self Care
title: Journaling for Self-Compassion
description: Learn Journaling for Self-Compassion in one minute.

hook.text: Writing about a painful event with self-compassion reduces its emotional grip within a single session.

buildup.text: Self-compassion journaling asks three questions: what happened, how do others face similar struggles, what kindness do I need?

discovery.text: Pennebaker's research showed that expressive writing improves immunity, mood, and cognitive processing of events.

twist.text: Writing without the self-compassion lens can become rumination. The three questions prevent spiraling inward.

climax.text: Spend five minutes writing about today's hardest moment. Use all three self-compassion lenses. Notice what shifts.

punchline.text: Write with compassion. Five minutes can shift your whole day.

quiz.question: What makes self-compassion journaling different from regular journaling?
options: It structures writing through mindfulness, humanity, and kindness lenses
